post: Did your students celebrate Constitution Day last week? 🎉 Log your classroom activities in the Civic Star Challenge today and you could earn recognition + prizes for work youve already done! 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #ConstitutionDay  #America250

📜  #OTD in 1789, Congress proposed the Bill of Rights, outlining essential protections for individual liberty and limiting government power. How can we help students connect these rights to their own responsibilities as citizens? Lesson on assembly & petition:  https://bit.ly/46TnWxC  #TDiH  #CivicEducation  #BillOfRights  #CivicVirtues

Students from across the state will showcase service projects, pitch new ideas, and compete for up to $2,000 in prizes. 📅 Dont miss outregister now:  https://bit.ly/45YV1rx Florida MyImpact Challenge is hosted by the Bill of Rights Institute thanks to our sponsor Travelers.  #FloridaStudents  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicLeadership  #ServiceLearning  #YouthLeadership

📜  #OTD in 1957, President Eisenhower issued Executive Order 10730, sending federal troops to protect the Little Rock Nine as they integrated Central High School. How can this moment help students understand the role of the federal government in protecting rights? Check out this lesson:  https://bit.ly/3YdZvqS  #TDiH  #CivilRights  #CivicEducation  #EqualProtection

The 2025–2026 MyImpact Challenge is here! Students nationwide are designing civic projects that embody Americas founding principles and prepare the next 250 years of self-government. 🔗 Support the next generation of leaders:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #America250  #CivicEngagement

What does it take to prepare the next generation for self-government? At the Bill of Rights Institute, we believe it takes hands-on learning, authentic engagement, and opportunities for students to see themselves as civic leaders. On September 17, more than 750 students in Bay City, Michigan joined us for Civicspalooza, a daylong celebration of Constitution Day filled with civics competitions, debates, civic action workshops, and connections with local leaders. Events like Civicspalooza remind us that civic education is not just about knowledge of history and government, its also about empowering young people to embody constitutional principles like equality, justice, and liberty in their daily lives. 🔗 Read more about Civicspalooza and BRIs work:  https://bit.ly/424ZW82  #CivicEducation  #ConstitutionDay  #StudentVoice  #Leadership
